alert.note: Alert for Mariposa (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 29 at 9:56PM PDT until May 01 at 10:00AM PDT by NWS Hanford
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in California... Merced River at Pohono Bridge affecting Mariposa County. .Warm temperatures will melt high mountain snowpack and increase river flows. For the Merced River...including Pohono Bridge...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Merced River at Pohono Bridge. * WHEN...Until late Monday morning. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Western portion of North Pines Campground located at the east end of Yosemite Valley between the confluence of the Merced River and Tenaya Creek begins to flood. Water rises to the base of the swinging bridge downstream from Chapel Meadow. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 AM PDT Saturday the stage was 9.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage just after midnight tonight to a crest of 10.3 feet late tonight. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 10.2 feet on 06/09/1978. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Sunday morning by 1000 AM PDT.
